DOC.brief_summary: This clinical study design validate usability safety over-the-counter ( OTC ) device obtain feedback home use environment regard ease use The Stork™ Conception System instruction use . In addition usability , result safety , include vaginal
DOC.brief_title: The Stork OTC : Collection , Placement & Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: Female participant undergo baseline pelvic examination . Participating couple give The Stork™ Conception System ( OTC ) , include Instructions Use , questionnaire two ziplock bag . The device use accordance instruction use . Participants use Conceptacle collection condom sexual intercourse . Participants remove Cervical Cap Sheath Conceptacle discard Sheath . Participants load Cervical Cap Applicator insertion , placement deployment device . Participants wash applicator soap water place double zip lock bag . During time cervical cap insert , normal activity recommend exception intercourse . The female participant leave conception cap inserted period time 4 12 hour , return investigator 's office examination , remove Cervical Cap , undergo follow pelvic examination . Participants ask complete study questionnaire within 3 day receive study packet . As result , study could take 4 day complete per enrolled couple .
DOC.criteria: Literacy must English ( able understand Informed Consent ) In general good health Heterosexual , monogamous couple , race ethnicity , sexually active ( couple ) 18 50 year age REALMSF Test Results demonstrate 6th grade literacy Past experience use condom Trying conceive use nonvaginal birth control normally use condom . Signed Informed Consent Vaginal prolapse ( female ) Hysterectomy ( female ) Erectile Dysfunction ( male ) Colposcopy biopsy surgery within last three ( 3 ) month ( female ) Treatment dysplasia surgery within last three ( 3 ) month ( female ) Vaginal/cervical surgery within last three ( 3 ) month ( female ) Current Pregnancy ( female ) Unable read understand English
